page.title: 01KINLOCHEWE AND HILLS TO WEST
page.content: This area is dominated by the small settlement of Kinlochewe and the hilly area forms part of a national nature reserve featuring rough heathery hills, some parts of which have been planted with coniferous trees. The village of Kinlochewe has around 80 inhabitants and includes a primary school with one teacher, a post office, hotel, several food stores and 2 petrol stations. There is a small proportion of the inhabitants engaged in seasonal employmenr, and permanent employment comes from the estates, nature conservancy council but self-employment is the main means of employment. The area has a number of small crofts, mostly stocked and grazed with sheep, and one sizeable tenanted mixed farm.
